replies.body: How old is Ahri? Why does Xayah say she betrayed her Heritage? How did Ahri and Wukong become friends?
Yes we need to know{{champion:103}}
I'm guessing in her attempt to be more humanoid, even though humans are the enemy of there species. and that's the betrayal
Why does Nami have breasts, Fish don't need to breast feed. They lay eggs, {{sticker:zombie-brand-facepalm}}   Please hire an Oceanography.
she's not a fish...

Even so...
http://forums.na.leagueoflegends.com/board/attachment.php?attachmentid=887584

*Marine biologist {{sticker:zombie-brand-facepalm}} 

And Vastaya, as stated above, give live birth. Those breasts will useful if Nami ever has children.
"an Oceanography"

I know the reason for this!  Vastaya are a fusion between humans, and animals, with a spirit as the catalyst, the reason is that at one point, they were part human, and adaptation hasn't kicked out the mammaries yet, it's possible even that they're more like platypus'!
they were made from bestiality!

Does Ahri still want to become human? It isn't outright stated in her bio or either of her stories but Xayah's interactions with her could lead to that interpretation.

P.S. Just wanna say I love absolutely everything about Nami's new bio and story, really knocked it out of the park with that one.
Ahri WAS a human, and she regrets having to eat people's souls, but there is nothing taht hints to her wishing to revert back to a human.
No I don't think that's right. I'm pretty sure vastaya are vastaya from the minute they're born, I don't think they start out as human and then become animal people.
I think it was said in her lore that she wanted to become something _better_, but not necessarily human. Don't take my word on that though.
Is ahri evil?
Maybe not straight-up EVIL, as she hates herself for what she does.  Definitely morally questionable though.
So wait, what's the deal with Swain? There is dialogue for him but they only refer to him with vastaya blood?{{champion:50}}
to be continued in the noxus event.
I hope he sacrificed a vastaya for his powers. Or trapped one and draws from its power. Something dark.

I love LOL's story.
So I wish for such a plan many times!

I want to ask this question in  Demacia Q＆A
"How did Lucian and Senna meet and fall in love with each other?"
{{sticker:slayer-jinx-catface}}
I read this and I was relieved that {{champion:238}}  also not a complete bad guy.
He is.
Read the story of Jhin on the wiki, Zed is not completely bad.
Isn't Jhin schizophrenic though? I figured he doesn't understand the line between his fantasies and reality and doesn't see value in life because of it.
Ummm what?  He wants to kill all non shadow ninjas and according to this he almost definitely knows that his shadow magic is hurting wild magic, he just give a fuck.

False. He doesn't want to kill non-shadow ninjas. He has a temporary truce with Shen, Kennen, Akali, and the rest of the Kinkou. He simply wants others to follow in the path of the Shadow, or alternatively "die in darkness", He doesn't say "Oh, you aren't shad0w man, u ded LUL". He gives them the choice of learning the "truth" or dying in the darkness of ignorance. Zed's relationship with the Vastaya, on the other hand, is completely morally questionable. As according to Rakan, he "messed with Xayah", most likely trying to steal her magic following the events of the latest cinematic (the name of which I've completely forgotten because I'm a scrub). But in terms of his relationship with other Clans or ninjas, or Ionians in general, Zed only kills those who threaten his Order or his land (in this case, Jhin and Noxus), but to kill Jhin, he needs Shen's help and vice versa. His Order was also noted fighting in the Noxian-Ionian War, along side the Wuju Masters (pre-Singed), Yasuo's clan, and the Kinkou. Yes this post is biased. But that's beyond the point. Just because Zed is painted to be a bad-guy, doesn't mean he's a "bad guy". "Ignorance is fatal". Inb4 someone points out Master Kusho's death and the slaughter of the students, we don't really know what went down in the Temple to cause Zed to do that. Zed just wanted his box, but Kusho had to fuck things up somehow.

I loved the thread but i have 1 question; What is your current thoughts on {{champion:107}} this patch? He is sitting on a 43% win rate, I feel like you guys just threw this rework at us and not really put much time into his kit. Riot I'm being serious, you guys took a step backwards, not a step forward. 

Instead of 'reworking' {{champion:107}} Why don't you just scrap his whole kit and make a whole completely new design? He's honestly so fun to play that it sucks just seeing the champion i've once loved is being gutted to shit. (Excuse me for language) But in all seriousness, this new Rengar is clunky, it feels like it was rushed. When the rework was announced I was so excited but as soon as I played him, I was so disappointed. The Q ability is really what gets me, it seems like Riot was going into a direction where he's a 'bruiser'. Well I know you guys were, I heard Ghostcrawler say it in a interview. I've honestly drawed away from League because the way this rework has put Rengars stats to shit. I got almost 1 mil mastery on him, ( http://championmasterylookup.derpthemeus.com/summoner/?summoner=MsKatlyn&region=NA)

But for now, I don't wanna play him anymore. This isn't a rant this is asking to not have a repeat of the old Rengar. He has counterplay. I promise.
This is a lore Q & A, not patch notes. If you want to put this in a place where it's appropriate (and I hope you do), put it on the boards or wait until next week's patch notes.
Yes I realized this and I'm sorry, I posted this comment when there was no other comments, and I was thinking to myself is this the right place?
It's really good that you realized that. I'm honestly really relieved that you replied like this, considering what's to be expected from the community. Thank you for renewing my faith in them.
Correction - his win rate is 45.98%, which isn't that bad.  You shouldn't blame riot for your inability to play a champion.
rengar top try it
I have, its alright but can easily be shut down by a tank or if you're ganked early a lot.
What about {{champion:268}} {{champion:75}} {{champion:58}} ?
Azir is an ascendant
I don't know why, but that egg question was a burning question I didn't know I needed the answer to.
Are you ever going to bring back the Darkin? It seems like riot has just forgotten about them.

They've actually mentioned that the Darkin have not been forgotten, but they've got a lot of work to do with different champion updates like with yorick, warwick, Galio, and to be revealed this year, Urgot. Its not a matter of them forgetting about them, its making sure that lore updates come out with the champion updates or champion reveals.

"Volibear is more akin to a primal Freljordian nature spirit/force of nature."

So why is Rengar a Vastaya?  Seems to me like he's much like Voli, his own creature separate from the Vastaya.  Wukong, Nami, Ahri (despite her origin), these feel like Vastaya.  Rengar... he's an anthro lion/tiger being, much as Voli is an anthro bear.  He just doesn't feel like he fits the mold to me.  Not enough human in him.
True he isn't much human, but he is part of an Ionian tribe, the Khiilash, and he is closely tied to the nature magics like the other Vastaya (according to his lore). I think this is enough proof.
I want to learn something about Sona's lore. We know very little about her past or why her instrument is so special.

There was an update to Sona's lore a while back, I can't remember where to find it though.  I do remember it went into detail about how she was left at an orphanage in Ionia, and the instrument was with her.  As she grew the people who ran the orphanage realized she couldn't speak and that the instrument would find its way back to her if they were separated.  It was long and rather complex, I'll post a link if I find one.
Actually the bottom of this page (http://gameinfo.na.leagueoflegends.com/en/game-info/champions/sona/#champion-lore) is apparently what I was thinking about hope this helps.

This question is for Marc Merill. Will we see any other races of humans apart from white, and black people? I've seen Overwatch bring a hispanic character into light; is it possible that you may bring someone that is Indian, Native American, etcetera.

{{champion:64}} {{champion:43}} {{champion:117}} {{champion:5}} {{champion:77}} {{champion:163}} {{champion:15}} {{champion:420}} {{champion:102}} {{champion:76}} 

It's strange, not only does league have what you're asking, it also has fictional races that are included as well.
They did her name is Taliyah

I have a question. What about Kindred, do the Vastaya still follow they're rules or are they specific to humans only? Further on what about the other races of Runeterra? {{champion:203}} ~Sincerely Someone who loves Kindred's lore and doesn't want them to be forgotten.

Kindred isn't really of Runeterran origin, to my knowledge. They're basically the physical embodiment of Death, and have no relation to any of the regions or species (Voidborn, Vastaya, Ascended,
 etc.) but, they MIGHT have something to do with the Shadow Isles, but I highly doubt it. Like ASol being the B00p Darg0n of Universe Making, Brad being the Mystical Chimer who Chimes, Nocturne being the Sp00py Dream Gh0st, and Kalista being the Gh0st Revengance Lady, Kindred is a more otherworldly being with the physical embodiment of a certain force. We have the Merciful and quick death (Lamb), and a Merciless and vicious death (Wolf).
